<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Husk Zombie](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1919)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Rather than allow a body to rot, some necromancers attempt to dry-cure the corpse to prevent further deterioration. Combined with special reagents, this process can preserve a rudimentary form of intelligence, allowing husk zombies to act more like predators than their mindless kin. Most husk zombies have no memories of their prior lives, though some keep trinkets from that time, oblivious as to why they value such items. A rare few husk zombies retain most of their former knowledge, though they tend to have gaps in their memory.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 16

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Zombie_HuskZombie.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 2">[Husk Zombie](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1919)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
<trait label="Zombie" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=245" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 170</row>

**Perception** +5; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +8, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +6, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +6, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +3

**Con** +3

**Int** -1

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +0
</row>

**Slow** A husk zombie is permanently [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) and can't use reactions.

**Items**
[Shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 17 

**Fort** +7 

**Ref** +9 

**Will** +7 

</row>

**HP** 55
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Weaknesses**
[positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) 5, slashing 5

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shortsword +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d6+4 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 1d8+4 bludgeoning

**[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)**   The husk zombie deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures.

**Sudden Surge** <actions string="Free Action" />  **Trigger** The husk zombie's turn begins; **Effect** The husk zombie has a sudden burst of speed. They are [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32) this turn and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the husk zombie's first action this turn is a melee Strike, the target is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against the attack. The husk zombie can't use Sudden Surge again until after they spend at least 10 minutes standing motionless.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Saved Sentience</title>

The rituals to make husk zombies (and withered zombies) require extra steps that involve applying special herbs or tonics to the body before burial. Whether the process preserves the creature's memories is unpredictable at best. For most necromancers, this additional preparation seems like a waste of time as they prefer the total obedience of a mindless zombie. Though most husk zombies want only to hunt and kill, a few try to maintain a more balanced, even cosmopolitan lifestyle.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-103" />
name: Husk Zombie
